description.narrative: The NFMRA is a major and consistent revenue earning agency for Nauru, mainly through license fees from the tuna fishery and also has a responsibility for managing coastal fisheries resources to support Nauru’s food security objectives. The Authority’s current operational systems, organisational structure, IT capacity and communication equipment are not adequate in order for it to fulfil its national and international mandate. In response to the need for the Authority to better meet its mandate, the FFA fielded a design team in 2007 and prepared an Institutional Strengthening Project Design Document (PDD) that covered a comprehensive range of activities, with the cost at a total of $2.4m over a period of four years. The PDD outlines activities and procurement with a focus on improving the policy, organisational and operational capacity of the Authority to maximise both income and national benefit from Nauru’s fishery.
